item.title: 1 Billion Build Minutes Later: How we reinvented CI/CD at Atlassian
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ In 2022, Atlassian recognized the need to streamline its CI/CD process due to fragmentation and inefficiencies. üõ†Ô∏è The solution? Consolidating efforts on Bitbucket Pipelines to support over 9,000 users, enhancing reliability and flexibility while maintaining team autonomy. Key focus areas included enterprise-grade scale, centralized standards, and preparing for AI advancements. Discover how Atlassian is transforming its development landscape! üåê #Atlassian #CICD #SoftwareDevelopment‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: aacosta
Category: technical_deep_dives

item.title: Self-Assessing your Enterprise Strategy and Planning maturity
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Assessing your enterprise strategy and planning maturity is key for continuous improvement. üìà Organizations must understand their position on the maturity spectrum to enhance alignment and execution. This can lead to better revenue generation, cost savings, and risk mitigation. Atlassian emphasizes the importance of setting and operationalizing strategy through six facets: Goals, Funds, Work, Systems, Talent, and Updates. Utilize this assessment as a benchmark and revisit it regularly. üóìÔ∏è‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: dhuether
Category: educational

item.title: From contextual understanding to execution: AI that truly works as part of your team
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Exciting updates in Rovo Chat enhance team collaboration! New features allow teams to tackle complex tasks with ease. Rovo can now autonomously break down requests and gather insights from various Atlassian tools. Additionally, Rovo‚Äôs improved memory understands your organization‚Äôs context, making interactions more efficient. Explore how Rovo Chat can work as a true team member today! #AI #Teamwork #RovoChat #Atlassian #Productivity

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: dfee
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Improving Coding Agent Experience
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Atlassian is enhancing the coding agent experience through machine learning. This aims to identify well-scoped Jira work items and provide relevant code context, leading to more efficient AI-powered development for software teams. Key indicators of effective task descriptions include detailed descriptions, presence of file paths, code snippets, and technical terms. These elements help coding agents understand and act on tasks more effectively. For implementation, Atlassian is considering both‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: Jovana Dunisijevic
Category: product_announcements

item.title: Comment ranker ‚Äì An ML-based classifier to improve LLM code review quality using Atlassian‚Äôs proprietary data
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Atlassian has introduced an ML-based comment ranker to enhance code review quality using proprietary data. This tool, part of the Rovo Dev agents, helps developers by filtering comments generated by LLMs, significantly improving efficiency. In its open beta, it has already supported over 43K PRs monthly and reduced PR cycle time by 30%. The comment ranker optimizes comment selection based on success metrics, ensuring only valuable feedback is highlighted for developers. #Atlassian #CodeReview‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: Jovana Dunisijevic
Category: technical_deep_dives

item.title: Atlassian‚Äôs AI Gateway: Best in Class Model Garden
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ Atlassian has launched its AI Gateway, a solution designed to streamline access to various LLMs from top providers like OpenAI and Google. This platform supports developers by offering a curated model garden with over 20 LLMs and integrates seamlessly with existing tools. It features a unified API for easy model switching and automated fallback options for reliability. All models maintain zero data retention, ensuring user privacy and security. #Atlassian #AI #MachineLearning #LLM‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: Christopher Cheung
Category: product_announcements

item.title: To Bitbucket from Jenkins: Enhancing Developer Experience
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Atlassian‚Äôs latest article discusses the advantages of transitioning from Jenkins to Bitbucket Cloud with Bitbucket Pipelines for CI/CD. The 2025 State of DevEx report reveals that 50% of developers lose over 10 hours weekly due to inefficiencies, and only 16% of their time is spent on coding. This highlights the need for better tools to enhance developer experience. The article also outlines the setup process for Jenkins, emphasizing the complexities involved. #DevExperience #Bitbucket‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: Warren Marusiak
Category: educational

item.title: How TitanApps Migrated Smart Checklist to Forge (and Got It to Run on Atlassian)
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üöÄ TitanApps shares the journey of migrating Smart Checklist to Forge, ensuring it meets security standards and runs smoothly on Atlassian. The team tackled challenges like data migration without downtime, all while retaining the app‚Äôs reliability for thousands of users. This migration highlights the importance of planning and adapting to new technologies. For those considering a similar move, this post offers valuable insights. #Atlassian #SmartChecklist #ForgeMigration #TechInnovation‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: kwhite@atlassian.com
Category: technical_deep_dives

item.title: AI needs human partners to elevate its work ‚Äì and keep it in check
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
AI is transforming industries, especially in pharmaceutical innovation. üß¨ Researchers at MIT are using generative AI to design new antibiotics, potentially speeding up drug development and addressing antibiotic resistance. However, AI tools in hiring reveal concerning biases. A recent study found that AI often suggests lower salaries for women and non-white candidates, highlighting the need for human oversight. Understanding these dynamics is crucial for effective human-AI collaboration. ü§ñ‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: Lauren Parker
Category: industry_analysis

item.title: From insights to impact: Content design research at Atlassian
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
At Atlassian, effective content design is rooted in research. This guide outlines a structured approach to planning and executing content design research. Start by defining your research goals with a concise plan that aligns your team. Key components include understanding user needs, research questions, and methods. Choose appropriate research methods to gather insights, combining qualitative and quantitative approaches for comprehensive results. Techniques like unmoderated surveys can‚Ä¶

Source: Atlassian Developer Blog
Author: jsandhu
Category: educational
